title: Installation issue: cp2k@6.1 (installs but fails cp2k regression test)
body:
CP2K (Chemistry/ Molecular dynamics package) installs but fails a simple regression test that is provided with the package. (Produces incorrect results.)

CP2K comes with a comprehensive set of regression tests (http://cp2k.org/dev:regtesting) that I could not get to work after several attempts. (I am not an expert in setting up ARCH files etc that is required to do this).  **Probably a good feature to include in Spack ! Regression testing for some of the scientific codes available through Spack.**

But anyway I plough forward and try this:
```console
cp2k.popt  cp2k/tests/QS/C.inp >output.txt 
```
Results in output.txt are incorrect when compared to those from an installation standardly available at the stampede2 cluster (XSEDE, presumably passed all regression tests.) 


### ### 
### Steps to reproduce the issue
```console
$spack install cp2k@6.1 +plumed ^openmpi@3.1.3
```
Had to install an older version of openmpi because build fails with "assembler error" for the newer versions. **During cp2k runs there was a runtime warning shown below, however the run finished and produced results.**

Warning produced:
```console
$cp2k.popt  cp2k/tests/QS/C.inp >output.txt
------------------------------------------------------------------------
No OpenFabrics connection schemes reported that they were able to be
used on a specific port.  As such, the openib BTL (OpenFabrics
support) will be disabled for this port.

  Local device:         mlx4_0
  Local port:           1
  CPCs attempted:       rdmacm, udcm
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
[cypress1:33414] 19 more processes have sent help message help-mpi-btl-openib-cpc-base.txt / no cpcs for port
[cypress1:33414] Set MCA parameter "orte_base_help_aggregate" to 0 to see all help / error messages
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
```

### ### 
### Platform and user environment
```console
$ uname -a 
Linux cypress1 2.6.32-431.23.3.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Jul 31 17:20:51 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	CentOS release 6.5 (Final)
```
